title: Enhancing Critical Thinking in Healthcare Policy: Language Analysis-Based Hybrid Education Program

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate theoretical background and hands-on experience required (possesses academic text comprehension and basic argument structure analysis skills)
context.additional_context: Blended synchronous interaction and asynchronous e-learning activities in BYOD environments (developing critical expression skills and utilizing feedback through online discussion forums)

learning_goals: Achieve measurable improvement (≥80% of learners) in critically evaluating argument structures of healthcare policy texts (emphasizing textual analysis and logical fallacy identification)
Verify ability to synthesize stakeholder perspectives through policy document analysis via case study-based assessments (including discourse analysis and rhetorical technique evaluation)
Cultivate policy proposal writing skills using digital literacy in hybrid learning environments (strengthening academic writing and specialized terminology usage)
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
